title: Forty-two government MPs in crisis-hit Sri Lanka sits independently in parliament
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Forty-two government MPs in Sri Lanka on Tuesday (05) informed the Speaker of the House of their decision to sit independently in parliament after a worsening economic crisis precipitated a political crisis in the island nation.

National Freedom Front leader and former Industries Minister Wimal Weerawansa told parliament Tuesday morning that 17 MPs that represent 10 constituent parties of the ruling Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP)-led coalition now act independently of the government.
Weerawansa is joined by his colleagues Udaya Gammanpila, Vasudewa Nanayakkara, Gevindu Kumaratunga and others.
SLPP MP Anura Priyadarshana Yapa informed parliament that 12 SLPP MPs including Susil Premajayantha – who was sacked by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa some months ago – have also quit the government.
Joining the dissidents arer 14 MPs of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), according to former president Maithripala Sirisena.
The Ceylon Workers Congress (CWC), too, will function independently in parliament. (Colombo/Apr05/2022)
